document.title: Family Life Education Board of Education Guidelines and Standards of Learning for Virginia Public Schools

66B2CE8237CB40238D110359D412697C.description:
The focus is on the misuse of tobacco, alcohol, and other drugs.
Content includes the adverse effects of substance use and abuse on the individual and on
the many contributing factors to family violence, sexual violence, and child abuse.

2B69ADE099A14F7595D97417028C1AF2.description: The student will recognize the dangers of substance use and abuse.

34789E688EBE4E519F294AE74908F90B.description:
Discussion includes examining the motivation for using alcohol,
tobacco and other drugs, a need to feel "grown up," a need for peer acceptance, a "high"
from the temporary effects of drugs, and/or a relief from emotional pain. Emphasis is
placed on ways of dealing with one's needs and feelings without the use of drugs or other
substances.

64C3D2944C2D4B2F9F376BEFC1E599ED.description: The student will identify factors contributing to the use of drugs.

BFDA445268C84C1399926B4A58D6D8A4.description:
The terms child abuse and child neglect (including sexual abuse
and electronic harassment) are explained, as well as how to protect oneself and the
importance of confiding in a trusted adult such as a parent, teacher, minister, grandparent,
or guardian.

7F9AE2EC54544EC9B71D7FF0A453DF32.description: The student will describe the factors surrounding child abuse and child neglect.

994E4E2406CA4ADE8D4AE5FBCB37ADC6.description:
The focus is on sharing tasks within the family and helping,
supporting, and communicating with family members. Special attention is given to
appropriate assistance and support for and communication with family members who
have physical or mental disabilities.

A1E776047EF3412688BC3EAA2B58B445.description:
The student will become aware of the need to assume responsibility within the
family and to function effectively as a family member.

D44A0DD9BF324BAD84D28F6B465D3A2E.description:
This includes accepting personal responsibility for successes and
failures, taking pride in successes, and understanding that mistakes can result in positive
learning toward success next time.

9693110C4D924FE18D4AD004DC929768.description:
The student will develop awareness and acceptance of his or her strengths and
weaknesses.

F6DDA0BED742423393BC940103B26BB2.description:
Emphasis is placed on understanding and dealing with strong
emotions, both positive and negative. Students learn how to deal with joy and
exuberance, as well as those emotions resulting from loss, rejection, divorce, death,
illness, and moving. The student learns to manage appropriate responses to these feelings
and to avoid self-destructive or abusive behavior by using positive mental health
practices.

60FD75AC79184AF593C1ED4DDF2DEC9B.description:
The student will identify basic human emotions and effective ways of dealing with
them.

B7B2A6C3CAE94DCAB47E8B18B8B4B743.description:
Instruction includes the uniting of the sperm and the egg and the
development of the fetus inside the uterus.

8038C85214ED4D5691F1E4F52A81B54F.description:
The student will develop an awareness of human fertilization and prenatal
development.

40C07AC13D2F484296A714DD19CB1A8E.description:
The individual differences in growth patterns associated with
male and female sexual changes are presented. Male characteristics presented include:
increased width of shoulders, increased length of arms and legs, the pituitary gland that
controls physical growth through hormones, the appearance of pubic and axillary hair,
and changes in the voice. Female characteristics presented include: increased width and
roundness of hips, development of breasts, the pituitary gland that controls physical
growth through hormones, the appearance of pubic and axillary hair, and the onset of the
menstrual cycle. Emphasis is placed on the fact that the onset of sexual changes and
growth patterns varies with individuals and that this is natural and normal. Students are
helped on an individual basis to avoid anxiety if their development is ahead of or behind
their peers. The importance of postponing sexual activity is discussed as is the
importance of delaying childbearing. In addition, the importance of personal hygiene in
relation to these bodily changes is discussed. When problems arise, teachers and parents
are encouraged to continue working together in a team approach to problem solving.

BCE9E93229614C44BF8C62945C283EE8.description: The student will identify physical changes that begin to occur during puberty.

608E7B70E05D4BA5BC5D1EE414E65B03.description:
Emphasis is placed on the male reproductive organs: penis,
testicles, scrotum, and urethra; and on the female reproductive organs: uterus, ovaries,
vagina, and fallopian tubes.

0854E3270D2849D29FA7C7082DA3C4F6.description: The student will be able to identify the human reproductive organs.
